item.title: Taylor Swift Returns To Spotify, Amends Her Relationship To Streaming
item.description:
June 9, 2017 - The pop superstar announced her 'return' to streaming, but it's more complicated than that.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/06/09/532238490/taylor-swift-returns-to-spotify-amends-her-relationship-to-streaming
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Canada's Tech Firms Capitalize On Immigration Anxiety In The Age Of Trump
item.description: June 9, 2017 - "We feel that Canada has a window of opportunity here to be able to attract the best and the brightest," says one Canadian tech leader.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 9, 2017 - "We feel that Canada has a window of opportunity here to be able to attract the best and the brightest," says one Canadian tech leader. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/09/532220824/canadas-tech-firms-capitalize-on-immigration-anxiety-in-the-age-of-trump

item.title: The Faceless Boss: A Look Into The Uber Driver Workplace
item.description: June 9, 2017 - To recruit drivers, company leaders are fond of saying that at Uber, you can "Be Your Own Boss." But NPR found that many Uber drivers feel controlled by a boss that is both always there, yet faceless.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 9, 2017 - To recruit drivers, company leaders are fond of saying that at Uber, you can "Be Your Own Boss." But NPR found that many Uber drivers feel controlled by a boss that is both always there, yet faceless. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/09/531642304/the-faceless-boss-a-look-into-the-uber-driver-workplace

item.title: Uber Drivers Criticize Company For Shady Firing Practices
item.description: June 8, 2017 - Imagine that instead of your boss telling you — eye-to-eye — you get the news as an alert on your phone. That's how it works at Uber, and the Uber app's move to fire is sometimes made in error.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 8, 2017 - Imagine that instead of your boss telling you — eye-to-eye — you get the news as an alert on your phone. That's how it works at Uber, and the Uber app's move to fire is sometimes made in error. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/08/532120218/uber-drivers-criticize-company-for-shady-firing-practices

item.title: How Schools, Parents And Organizations Are Trying To Close The Achievement Gap
item.description:
June 8, 2017 - The achievement gap between white students and students of color is narrowing. What will it take to close it for good?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-08/how-schools-parents-and-organizations-are-trying-to-close-the-achievement-gap
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 8, 2017 - The achievement gap between white students and students of color is narrowing. What will it take to close it for good? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-08/how-schools-parents-and-organizations-are-trying-to-close-the-achievement-gap

item.title: Spies In The Field: As Farming Goes High-Tech, Espionage Threat Grows
item.description: June 8, 2017 - Recent cases involving Chinese nationals conspiring to steal trade secrets — from gene-spliced rice to corn seed — have highlighted the risk of intellectual property theft from U.S. companies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 8, 2017 - Recent cases involving Chinese nationals conspiring to steal trade secrets — from gene-spliced rice to corn seed — have highlighted the risk of intellectual property theft from U.S. companies. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/08/531771780/spies-in-the-field-as-farming-goes-high-tech-espionage-threat-grows

item.title: Uber Drivers Don't Feel Like Their Own Bosses
item.description: June 8, 2017 - Uber says drivers can each be their "own boss." But in an NPR survey, hundreds of drivers said they don't feel that way. They feel controlled by a boss that is both always there, and yet faceless.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 8, 2017 - Uber says drivers can each be their "own boss." But in an NPR survey, hundreds of drivers said they don't feel that way. They feel controlled by a boss that is both always there, and yet faceless. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/08/532022847/uber-drivers-dont-feel-like-their-own-bosses

item.title: Eager To Burst His Own Bubble, A Techie Made Apps To Randomize His Life
item.description: June 8, 2017 - Suddenly aware of repetitive feedback loops in his life, Max Hawkins created apps that decided where he should go, what strangers' parties he should attend, even how he should spend Christmas.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 8, 2017 - Suddenly aware of repetitive feedback loops in his life, Max Hawkins created apps that decided where he should go, what strangers' parties he should attend, even how he should spend Christmas. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/08/531796329/eager-to-burst-his-own-bubble-a-techie-made-apps-to-randomize-his-life

item.title: Free Speech Legal Center Threatens To Sue Trump For Blocking Twitter Users
item.description: June 7, 2017 - A First Amendment law center at Columbia University is threatening to sue President Trump if he doesn't stop blocking people whose comments he doesn't like on Twitter. The group says Trump cannot lawfully block people from viewing what they contend are presidential statements.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 7, 2017 - A First Amendment law center at Columbia University is threatening to sue President Trump if he doesn't stop blocking people whose comments he doesn't like on Twitter. The group says Trump cannot lawfully block people from viewing what they contend are presidential statements. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/07/531945516/free-speech-legal-center-threatens-to-sue-trump-for-blocking-twitter-users

item.title: Can The Nation's Voting System Be Trusted?
item.description:
June 7, 2017 - How can we best protect a system that delivers the peaceful transfer of power?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-07/can-the-nations-voting-system-be-trusted-working-title

item.title: Apple Takes On Distracted Driving With New Feature
item.description:
June 6, 2017 - The new feature blocks notifications while users are driving, but a loophole could allow text messages to still pop up.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/06/531777684/apple-takes-on-distracted-driving-with-new-feature
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: The Internet Of Things Is Becoming More Difficult To Escape
item.description: June 6, 2017 - In coming years, human and machine connectivity will continue to progress, despite concerns about vulnerabilities, making it increasingly difficult to withdraw from online tools, experts say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - In coming years, human and machine connectivity will continue to progress, despite concerns about vulnerabilities, making it increasingly difficult to withdraw from online tools, experts say. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/06/531747037/the-internet-of-things-is-becoming-more-difficult-to-escape

item.title: Can The Democracy Survive The Internet?: Lessons From 2016
item.description:
June 6, 2017 - "Can democracy survive the Internet?" Why one scholar was prompted to explore that question following the 2016 U.S. election.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-06/can-democracy-survive-the-internet
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - "Can democracy survive the Internet?" Why one scholar was prompted to explore that question following the 2016 U.S. election. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-06/can-democracy-survive-the-internet

item.title: Before Silicon Valley, New Jersey Reigned As Nation's Center Of Innovation
item.description: June 5, 2017 - Silicon Valley is known as the nation's tech hub, but decades ago New Jersey had that distinction. The state was once home to Thomas Edison's lab and Bell Labs, the home of Nobel laureates.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - Silicon Valley is known as the nation's tech hub, but decades ago New Jersey had that distinction. The state was once home to Thomas Edison's lab and Bell Labs, the home of Nobel laureates. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/05/531250084/before-silicon-valley-new-jersey-reigned-as-nations-center-of-innovation

item.title: Apple Joins Smart-Speaker Race With Music-Focused 'HomePod'
item.description: June 5, 2017 - The speaker is powered by Apple's personal assistant Siri and marks the long-awaited entry of the tech giant into competition with Amazon's and Google's smart home devices.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - The speaker is powered by Apple's personal assistant Siri and marks the long-awaited entry of the tech giant into competition with Amazon's and Google's smart home devices. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/05/531594351/apple-joins-smart-speaker-race-with-music-focused-homepod
